image_requirements.description: Model's feet planted firmly on the ground at hip width, body facing straight and forward to the camera.
Arms should be raised evenly at sides with a 25° degree angle from the body’s hips.
Camera should capture the entire garment with NO product, hands, or hair in the way.
Position the model in front of the camera, facing forward to shoot the front of the product.
Position the model to directly face the backdrop, ensuring hair is not on the back and no rotation in the body’s frame.
Separate the two products and take two additional shots: one for the front and another for the back.
Keep a gap between pant legs, including wide leg bottoms.
For flared or flowy sleeves, DO raise arms slightly to allow the product to lay more accordingly.

summary: This document outlines the guidelines for model positioning and capture setup for apparel photography, emphasizing correct positioning of the model, arms, and camera angles to ensure optimal representation of the product.
